race_form.race_comment: SWINGIN LIGHTENING (9) wasted no time getting off the mark on debut over 302m at Remington Park (Dirt) 11 weeks ago and has not raced since. Likely improver who should run well again. HOT RYDER (4) was prominent on straightening and broke through for her maiden win over 320m at Remington Park (Dirt) last time. Is lightly raced and has plenty of scope for improvement. Shaping up nicely and she cannot be discounted. LAZLES LIGHTS (8) impressed when successful on debut over 320m at Remington Park (Dirt) five-and-a-half weeks ago. Will come on following that run; definite threat. SFS CAPO DE GATO (1) made an encouraging debut last time out, finishing 1.1 lengths from the winner in third over 274m at Remington Park (Dirt). Open to plenty of improvement.

race_form.race_comment: ROWDY CHAOS (4) turned in a good run last time, finishing in the placings (19.29) at Manukau in a Class 0. Lines up from box 4 for the first time. Some good form is emerging from his last run. Sure to be about the mark. BOW BELL DEL (6) took advantage of the inside draw and gave a big sight in front when second and beaten 1.5 lengths (26.54) at this track in a Class 0 over 457m. Expected to feature again. OPAWA BLOSSOM (7) is overdue for a maiden success having placed at five of 14 starts, the latest missing the frame when fifth at this track. Yet to win out of this box but has been in the placings two times from four starts. In the mix. RECKLESS ERIC (3) must be included in calculations and can even win if he makes a better beginning.

race_form.race_comment: WISE GUY (6) finished second when resuming from a spell last start over 1408m at this track. Nicely placed and expected to go well. NATE'S REVENGE (1) finished sixth two runs back at Evangeline Downs (Dirt) then improved last time out to score by 1.3 lengths as favourite after being prominent at the bend over 1408m at Evangeline Downs (Dirt). Meets some better types this time but he has the talent to test this line-up. OKUDAH (11) showed good early muster and fought on to finish second when resuming last start over 1673m at this track (Dirt). Has to overcome a tricky draw. Looks well placed so expect another big run. POST CLOSE (7) finished fourth last start over 1408m at this track (Dirt) after racing on the pace for much of the way. Has ability and a bold showing is expected.

race_form.race_comment: TREASURE NIGHT (8) finished second when resuming from a spell last start over 1600m at this track. Looks to have an edge on most of these and can go one better today. PRIMOGENITO D'ORO (5) is a progressive four-year-old entire who resumes from a break of four-and-a-half months, his last appearance being a win over 2000m at this track. Best form puts him right in this. DOQUIER (6) resumes today after filling a minor placing at his only appearance last prep at San Isidro over 1600m on March 26. Has a decent record at this trip with three minor placings from four tries and has to be included. ICY VASCO (1) was beaten 4 lengths into fifth in a 1400m contest at this track three weeks ago. The step up to a mile will suit and he can bounce back into the money

race_form.race_comment: LOGARITMO (6) comes here off a break of four months. Worth noting he filled a minor placing when returning from a spell last prep over 1300m at this track. Now under the care of new trainer Leonardo Jose Dos Reis. He is the one to beat fresh up. QUENY LEE (5) resumes after a break of 12 weeks. Won on debut to launch the last campaign over 1200m at Cidade Jardim. Makes plenty of appeal. MEDSHOW (2) doesn't boast the best winning strike rate but ran a strong race last time out, finishing second and beaten only 1.3 lengths over 1000m at this track. Looks well placed so expect a big run this time. POLO NORTE (1) has been struggling to make an impression lately but gets his best chance in a while to put his hoof in the till. One more chance.
